```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(xml2)
library(rvest)
library(ggplot2)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
URL.DRUG<-"https://drugabusestatistics.org/"

DRUGS.ONE<-URL.DRUG%>%
  read_html()%>%
  html_table(fill = T)%>%
  .[[1]]%>%
  rename(`All Users` = "% Usership")%>%
  rename(`Adults` = "% Usership")
DRUGS.TWO<-URL.DRUG%>%
  read_html()%>%
  html_table(fill = T)%>%
  .[[2]]
DRUGS.ONE<- DRUGS.ONE[order(DRUGS.ONE$Substance),]
DRUGS.TWO<- DRUGS.TWO[order(DRUGS.TWO$Substance),]
```


```{r}
ggplot(DRUGS.ONE)%>%
  geom_bar(x = Substance, y = )
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
URL.SUICIDE<- "https://www.injuryfreenc.ncdhhs.gov/DataSurveillance/VDRS/OverallSuicide2018_FINAL.pdf"
SUICIDE.ONE<- URL.SUICIDE%>%
  read_html()%>%
  html_table(fill = T)%>%
  .[[1]]
```
